steps.title: Guided tour
steps.message: Welcome to Open Source Brain! This is a tutorial to help you understand what you can do with OSB.

steps.title: Model
steps.message: You are looking at the morphologies defined in a NeuroML model. You can visualize model metadata for this model by clicking on the Model Description button on the menu bar.

steps.title: Model
steps.message: You can have multiple experiments for your model, and only one experiment can be active at a given time. What you see now on screen is the content of the active experiment.

steps.title: Simulation Controls
steps.message: On the top right you can find the Simulation Controls, with them you can run/play/pause/stop an experiment.

steps.title: Experiments Table
steps.message: The experiments table displays all the experiments within the loaded project.

steps.title: Experiments Table
steps.message: Icons on the right side of the table allow for; setting an experiment active, downloading an experiment's model and results, deleting/cloning the experiment.

steps.title: Experiments Table
steps.message: Clicking on a given experiment row will show additional information, such as simulator of choice, parameters values and simulation time step. You can edit most of these fields by clicking on the values.

steps.title: Console
steps.message: The console allows you to control the experiment via command line as an alternative to the simulation controls on the UI. Every UI action maps to a console command, you can learn about commands by doing something on the UI and the looking at what shows up in the console.

steps.title: Persisting your project
steps.message: On the top bar you can find the persist button, in the shape of a star, with it you can add this model to your model collection for easy access. The button will be disabled if the model is already persisted.

steps.title: Camera Controls
steps.message: On the left side of the screen, you'll find the camera controls. With this you can explore the 3D morphologies by zooming in and out, and rotating the camera.

steps.title: Control Panel
steps.message: The control panel allows you to visualize and interact with the morphologies, state variables and parameters in a given model. The control panel can be opened and closed with the button on the left side bar or with the CTRL+P shortcut.

steps.title: Control Panel
steps.message: The control panel can be filtered to visualize morphologies. It is possible to hide, show, zoom and change the color of any of the cells and networks. Changes at the population level will be propagated to all the cells belonging to the population.

steps.title: Control Panel
steps.message: The control panel can be filtered to visualize the available state variables. If the active experiment is currently in DESIGN (orange icon in the experiments tab) then it is possible to decide what variables to record by clicking on the circle icon.

steps.title: Control Panel
steps.message: If the active experiment is completed (green icon in the experiments tab) the recorded filter lets you look only at the variables that were recorded.

steps.title: Control Panel
steps.message: The active experiment filters let you pick between state variables that belong to the active experiment or state variables that belong to any existing experiments. These filters apply also to parameters.

steps.title: Control Panel
steps.message: The global filter lets you peak into state variables and parameters that were recorded in other projects that belong to you

steps.title: Control Panel
steps.message: The parameter filters shows you the available parameters. If the active experiment is in DESIGN mode (orange icon in the experiments tab) you will be able to change the value of the parameters simply typing in their inlined textbox.

steps.title: Search
steps.message: You can use the search to find and interact with anything in your model by name, including state variables to be recorded and parameters to be set. The spotlight can be opened and closed with the button on the left side bar or with the CTRL+SPACE shortcut.

steps.title: Help
steps.message: To get more information about the OSB environment, launch the help window located above this window. In it you'll find more detailed documentation.

steps.title: Open Tutorial Again
steps.message: At anytime, if you wish to you can re-open this tutorial, look for the button on the left hand side of the screen.

steps.title: End of Guided Tour
steps.message: You reached the end of this tutorial, you can restart the tutorial or you can keep exploring on your own!
